funestim 1.0.0
  • Get started
  • Reference

Perform an estimation of the bandwidth for the estimation of the mean.

Source: R/estimate_bandwidth.R
estimate_bandwidth.Rd

This function performs an estimation of the bandwidth for a univariate kernel regression estimator defined over continuous data.

estimate_bandwidth(
  data,
  t0,
  H0 = 0.5,
  L0 = 1,
  sigma = 0,
  variance = 0,
  grid = lseq(0.001, 0.1, length.out = 101),
  nb_obs_minimal = 2,
  type_k = 2
)

Arguments

data

A list, where each element represents a curve. Each curve have to be defined as a list with two entries:

  • $t The sampling points

  • $x The observed points.
t0

Numeric, the sampling point at which we estimate the bandwidth.
H0

Numeric, an estimation of \(H_0\).
L0

Numeric, an estimation of \(L_0\).
sigma

Numeric, an estimation of \(\sigma\).
variance

Numeric, an estimation of the variance of the process.
grid

Vector, default=lseq(0.001, 0.1, length.out = 101). A grid of bandwidths.
nb_obs_minimal

Integer, default=2. Minimum number of points in the neighborhood to keep the curve in the estimation.
type_k

Integer, default=2. Used kernel.

  • 1 Uniform kernel

  • 2 Epanechnikov kernel

  • 3 Biweight kernel

Value

Numeric, an estimation of the bandwidth.

References

Golovkine S., Klutchnikoff N., Patilea V. (2021) - Adaptive estimation of irregular mean and covariance functions.

See also

Other estimate bandwidth: estimate_bandwidth_covariance()
